frameDefinitions: This frame consists of LUs which denote a Theme ceasing motion.
A Cognizer retains facts in memory and is able to retrieve them.
A Cognizer thinks of and performs an Action that is a self- or other-imposed task or some other kind of desirable behavior.
A Cognizer calls up an episodic memory of past Experience or an Impression of a Salient_entity formed  on the basis of past experience.
A Speaker reveals Information that was previously secret to an Addressee.
frameExamples: Peter <t>stopped</t> immediately and span to see Aeryn frozen where she stood.
Carolyn <t>abandoned</t> her car and jumped on a red double decker bus.
I was impressed that she 'd actually <t>remembered</t> Radish 's name (= what Radish's name is)
You invited everybody but you <t>forgot</t> Harry.
Kozmo could <t>remember</t> when his modem was the fastest he could buy.
Could it be true that Martin himself was the one who <t>spilled</t> the <t>beans</t> on Pops and Brad's planned wedding?
listRoleDefinitions: This role identifies <fen>Theme</fen> whose motion ceases.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Theme</fen> stops.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Theme</fen>'s motion stops.
The <fex name='Agent'>Agent</fex> is the person who acts to leave behind the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The <fex name='Theme'>Theme</fex> is the entity that is relinguished to no one from the <fex name='Agent'>Agent</fex>'s possession.
When the <fen>Agent</fen> gives up the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Agent</fen> gives up the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The person who retains and retrieves information.
<fen>Mental_content</fen> stored by and accessible to the <fen>Cognizer</fen>. It may derive from experience or activity or simply from being informed of it.
The time when the <fen>Cognizer</fen> retrieves <fen>Mental_content</fen> or forgets it.
The person who thinks of or fails to think of an obligatory or desireable <fen>Action</fen>.
An <fen>Action</fen> that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> is supposed to carry out. This may be a Task imposed specifically on the <fen>Cognizer</fen> or it may be self- or socially imposed.
The <fen>Salient_entity</fen> is a person or thing that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> needs to affect or effect when carrying out the <fen>Action</fen>.
A <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Cognizer</fen> remembers or fails to carry out an <fen>Action</fen>.
A person who recalls memories of past experience or impressions.
A person or thing that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> remembers as being involved in some state or event or as having some property.
A past event or state that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> witnessed and is now recalling. The <fen>Experience</fen> may be a specific event or state or a vaguer period that is treated as a unit.

A property that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> attributes to the <fen>Salient_entity</fen> based on their past experience of the <fen>Salient_entity</fen> or a category to which the <fen>Salient_entity</fen> is assigned.
A property or role that a <fen>Salient_entity</fen> actually held and which frames the memories that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has of the <fen>Salient_entity</fen>.
The time when the <fen>Cognizer</fen> remembers the experience.
The <fen>Speaker</fen> is the sentient entity that reveals  the <fen>Information</fen> (whether spoken or written).
<fen>Information</fen> identifies the content that the <fen>Speaker</fen> reveals to the <fen>Addressee</fen>.  It can be expressed as a clause or as a noun phrase.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject matter about which the <fen>Speaker</fen> is speaking. It normally only appears with noun targets, or in special constructions.
<fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used by the <fen>Speaker</fen> to transmit the statement.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the revelation is made.
The role specifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Information</fen> is revealed.
listRoleExamples: When the kitty was standing beside the slayer's pillow, <fex>she</fex> stopped to make sure everything was quiet
John stopped <fex>suddenly</fex>, whirled around and spread out his arms
She stopped <fex>on the threshold</fex> with a sinking heart
I bet <fex>Johno</fex> can remember the name of the Ramones' drummer.
Do you remember <fex>how to spell cupboard ?</fex>
<fex>Afterwards</fex>, I forgot what I was pissed off about, but I was.
.<fex>Alex and Zach Swindle</fex>, Centre, visited their brother in San Francisco in June and remembered to take along a copy of The Post>.
This time we remembered <fex>to turn the gas off before leaving</fex>.
We piled into the taxi and right when we were about to leave, I realized we forgot <fex>the video camera</fex>
He remembered <fex>afterwards</fex> to kiss her fingers.
I will truly miss Delmar and <fex>I</fex> will always remember when his eyes lit up everytime he got ice-cream.
today I saw a sister's exclassmate, and didn't recognise him, I remember <fex>him</fex> taller.
I can still remember <fex>saying the pledge every morning before class in elementary school</fex>, a rare occurrence among elementary school kids nowadays.
I remember Peter <fex>as immensely kind in those first three weeks before I was packed off to boarding school</fex>.
Atulprasad is principally remembered <fex>as a musician and composer</fex>.
I 'll <fex>never</fex> forget being in hospital
<fex>Kornfeldt</fex> revealed that he had embezzled more than twice the amount his company owned.
You shouldn't reveal <fex>any murders you've been involved in</fex>, if you know what I mean.
Revelations <fex>about the coming of the Christ</fex> surfaced in early Mediaeval times.
Kim confided in me <fex>over the phone</fex>.
According to the report, he confessed to eating onions and gargling with generic mouthwash <fex>at the station</fex>.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: Sarah Jane Smith - Elisabeth SladenHarrison Chase - Tony Beckley
The Quatermass Experiment and The Day of the Triffids
Richard Dunbar - Kenneth GilbertScorby - John Challis
Buckland Sand and Silica Co Ltd
